com.hp.autonomy.aci.content.sort

Class SortBy

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hp.autonomy.aci.content.sort.AbstractSort
      • com.hp.autonomy.aci.content.sort.SortBy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sort, Iterable<SortBy>

    public class SortBy
extends AbstractSort
    Class to represent the various sort specifiers. e.g. 
     
 String sort = SortBy.RELEVANCE
               .then(SortBy.alphabetical("VIRTUALPATHNAME"))
               .then(SortBy.AUTN_RANK)
               .toString();
    Instances are accessed via static fields or methods. All instances of SortBy should be immutable, though this class is not final to allow extensions for sort specifiers that do not currently exist.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SortBy

        protected SortBy(String sort)
        Constructor for creating a SortBy that only requires a specifier name.

        This constructor is protected to discourage its use, not because a subclass is strictly required. All of the current sort specifiers of this form exist as immutable, static fields of this class.

        Parameters:
        sort - The specifier name

      • SortBy

        protected SortBy(String sort,
                 String fieldname)
        Constructor for creating a SortBy that requires both a specifier name and a field name.

        This constructor is protected to discourage its use, not because a subclass is strictly required. All of the current sort specifiers of this form can be created via static methods of this class.

        Parameters:
        sort - The specifier name
        fieldname - The field name
